statement: Solve the system x + y + z = a, x² + y² + z² = b², xy = z². Give conditions on a and b so that x, y, z are distinct positive numbers.
Let a, b, c be the sides of a triangle and T its area. Prove a² + b² + c² ≥ 4√3 T and determine when equality holds.
Solve cosⁿx − sinⁿx = 1 for natural n.
In triangle P₁P₂P₃ with interior point P, lines P₁P, P₂P, P₃P meet opposite sides at Q₁, Q₂, Q₃. Prove that among P₁P/PQ₁, P₂P/PQ₂, P₃P/PQ₃ at least one is ≤ 2 and at least one is ≥ 2.
Construct triangle ABC given AC = b, AB = c and ∠AMB = ω (ω < 90°), where M is the midpoint of BC. Prove a solution exists iff b tan(ω/2) ≤ c < b and determine when equality holds.

Given non-collinear points A, B, C on one side of plane ε, take arbitrary points A′, B′, C′ in ε. Let L, M, N be midpoints of AA′, BB′, CC′ and G the centroid of triangle LMN. Find the locus of G as A′, B′, C′ vary independently in ε.
